Award.AwardTitle: Biophotonics: MEMS-Based Endoscopic Optical Confocal Imaging

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
0423557
Xie
In this project, a new MEMS-based OCM (u-OCM) imaging system is proposed. The proposed imaging probe will be only 5 mm in diameter. The fast scanning (< 1 millisecond) and large z-axis tunable range (~2 mm) of the employed microlens is enabled by a novel large-vertical-displacement (LVD) microactuator technique. The following tasks will be pursued: 1) to develop LVD microactuators with at least 2-mm z-axis travel range; 2) to design and fabricate LVD micromirrors and microlenses; 3) to package and assemble LVD micromirrors and microlenses into a fiberoptic imaging probe; and 4) to test the imaging probe in physical phantoms.
